str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
From an obsolete primary noun; 'ever, 'by qualification regularly; by implication, earnestly.
To remind, remember, call to mind. From hupo and mimnesko; to remind quietly, i.e. Suggest to the memory.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
Although, though. From kai and per; and indeed, i.e. Nevertheless or notwithstanding.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From a presumed derivative of histemi; to set fast, i.e. to turn resolutely in a certain direction, or to confirm.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.
